## FAQs

If you're ready to dive into bigger data and projects, get prepared with these FAQs outlining best tools and practices.

### Best Practices
<h3 id="What is DRY and why does it matter?" class="visually-hidden">What is DRY and why does it matter?</h3>
<details>
<summary class="faq-summary">What is DRY and why does it matter?</summary>

DRY stands for 'Don't Repeat Yourself'. It's a principle that encourages reusable, modular code to reduce duplication and improve maintainability.

</details>

<h3 id="What is code documentation and why should I use it?" class="visually-hidden">What is code documentation and why should I use it?</h3>
<details>
<summary class="faq-summary">What is code documentation and why should I use it?</summary>

Documentation explains what your code does and why. Good documentation makes it easier to debug, share, and revisit code later.

</details>


### Tools
<h3 id="Should I use notebooks or scripts?" class="visually-hidden">Should I use notebooks or scripts?</h3>
<details>
<summary class="faq-summary">Should I use notebooks or scripts?</summary>

Use notebooks for exploration and explanation. Use scripts for automation, scalability, and production workflows.

</details>

<h3 id="Why is version control important?" class="visually-hidden">Why is version control important?</h3>
<details>
<summary class="faq-summary">Why is version control important?</summary>

Version control helps you track changes, collaborate with others, and revert to earlier versions if something goes wrong. Git is the most common system.

</details>


### Datasets
<h3 id="What are the most common data issues?" class="visually-hidden">What are the most common data issues?</h3>
<details>
<summary class="faq-summary">What are the most common data issues?</summary>

Common data issues include missing values, outliers, and incorrectly formatted or malformed data. These can impact analysis and must be handled carefully before modeling.

</details>

<h3 id="What are summary statistics?" class="visually-hidden">What are summary statistics?</h3>
<details>
<summary class="faq-summary">What are summary statistics?</summary>

Summary statistics describe and summarize data. Common examples include mean, median, standard deviation, minimum, and maximum.

</details>

<h3 id="What is basic analysis?" class="visually-hidden">What is basic analysis?</h3>
<details>
<summary class="faq-summary">What is basic analysis?</summary>

Basic analysis often includes computing correlations, visualizing distributions, identifying trends, and checking assumptions before building models.

</details>
